arrayGenerator

Class ScopedArrayGeneratorTest<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • arrayGenerator.ArrayGeneratorTest<T>
      • arrayGenerator.ScopedArrayGeneratorTest<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CharacterArrayGeneratorTest, IntegerArrayGeneratorTest

    abstract class ScopedArrayGeneratorTest<T>
extends ArrayGeneratorTest<T>
    Implements additional tests, in addition to those inherited from ArrayGeneratorTest, to check that:
    • Values in generated arrays are within the specified scope
    • All values in the scope are generated. Note: this is a statistical test, and may produce a false fail. See testCoversRange(Scope) for details.
    Version:
    October 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

      When testing that a generated array contains all the values within the generator's scope, only a statistical check can be carried out.

    • Field Detail

      • ACCEPTABLE_FALSE_FAIL

        private static final double ACCEPTABLE_FALSE_FAIL
        When testing that a generated array contains all the values within the generator's scope, only a statistical check can be carried out. Since values are generated at random, there is always a chance that a generated array, however large, may not contain all the values. However, the larger the generated array, the smaller this chance of a "false fail" is. ACCEPTABLE_FALSE_FAIL specifies the acceptable probability for such a false fail occuring.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        ScopedArrayGeneratorTest()

    • Method Detail

      • getGenerator

        abstract ScopedArrayGenerator<T> getGenerator(Scope<T> scope)
        Implementing classes must implement this method to return the sort of ScopedArrayGenerator the implementing class is intended to test.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope of the array generator to be tested.
        Returns:
        a scoped array generator of the required type and specified scope.

      • testWithinRange

        void testWithinRange(Scope<T> scope,
                     int size)
        Check that the array contents are within the specified range.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope to be tested
        size - the size of the array

      • testCoversRange

        void testCoversRange(Scope<T> scope)
        Check that a generated array contains all the expected values. Note: since values are generated at random, there is always a chance that a generated array may not contain all values within the range. The size of the generated array is set to 1/c(n*H(n)) where
        • c is the probability that the array will not contain all values (i.e. the chance of a "false fail") - so the ACCEPTABLE_FALSE_FAIL above.
        • n is the number of values within the scope of this generator, and
        • H(n) is the nth harmonic number (ie. 1/1 + 1/2 + ... + 1/n)
        H(n), in turn is approximately n*ln(n) + gamma*n, where gamma is approximately 0.5772156649. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coupon_collector%27s_problem.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope to be tested.
